alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 5:20AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF HEAVY SNOW IN VALDEZ AND THOMPSON PASS TONIGHT... Light snow or a rain/snow mix today will increase in intensity and become all snow tonight. With light winds at lower elevations, the heavy snow will dynamically cool the atmosphere, keeping precipitation all snow tonight. While periods of heavy snow are likely tonight, especially between 9pm tonight and 6am Friday, the fast-moving nature of the storm will limit the duration of the heavy snow, keeping storm total accumulations below advisory criteria. However, 12 to 18 inches of snow are expected. Total accumulations around 12 inches of snow are expected in Valdez, where temperatures will be warmer, resulting in a wetter snow. Meanwhile storm total accumulations closer to 18 inches are expected in Thompson Pass and higher elevations through Friday morning.
